Docs.param: The memory block with the decoded bitmap.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult GetPixels (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, byte[] pixels);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult GetPixels(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, unsigned int8[] pixels) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the desired output format expected by the caller.
The memory block to hold the decoded bitmap, with a length of at least .
Docs.summary: Decode the bitmap into the specified memory block.
Docs.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

remarks.para: The specified , can either be , or a new instance with a different configuration - which the codec may choose to ignore.
If the spcified size is different from the size from , then the codec will attempt to scale the resulting bitmap. If the codec cannot perform this scale, this method will return .

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult GetPixels (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, IntPtr pixels, SkiaSharp.SKColorTable colorTable, ref int colorTableCount);

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult GetPixels(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, native int pixels, class SkiaSharp.SKColorTable colorTable, int32 colorTableCount) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the desired output format expected by the caller.
The memory block to hold the decoded bitmap, with a total size of at least .
The color table to hold the color entries.
The logical number of color table entries.
Docs.summary: Decode the bitmap into the specified memory block.
Docs.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

remarks.para: The specified , can either be , or a new instance with a different configuration - which the codec may choose to ignore.
If the spcified size is different from the size from , then the codec will attempt to scale the resulting bitmap. If the codec cannot perform this scale, this method will return .
If specified color type is , then the caller must provide a . On success, the codec will copy the colors into that storage, and set colorTableCount to the logical number of table entries.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult GetPixels (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, IntPtr pixels, IntPtr colorTable, ref int colorTableCount);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult GetPixels(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, native int pixels, native int colorTable, int32 colorTableCount) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the desired output format expected by the caller.
The memory block to hold the decoded bitmap, with a total size of at least .
The pointer to the color table to hold the color entries, with a length of at least (256).
The logical number of color table entries.
Docs.summary: Decode the bitmap into the specified memory block.
Docs.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

remarks.para: The specified , can either be , or a new instance with a different configuration - which the codec may choose to ignore.
If the spcified size is different from the size from , then the codec will attempt to scale the resulting bitmap. If the codec cannot perform this scale, this method will return .

If specified color type is , then the caller must provide a color table array, with a length of at least 256. On success, the codec will copy the colors into that storage, and set colorTableCount to the logical number of table entries.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKSizeI GetScaledDimensions (float desiredScale);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKSizeI GetScaledDimensions(float32 desiredScale) cil managed

Docs.param: The desired scale factor.
Docs.summary: Returns a size that approximately supports the desired scale factor.
Docs.returns: Returns a supported size.
Docs.remarks: The codec may not be able to scale efficiently to the exact scale factor requested, so return a size that approximates that scale. Upscaling is not supported, so the original size will be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetValidSubset (ref SkiaSharp.SKRectI desiredSubset);
.method public hidebysig instance bool GetValidSubset(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRectI desiredSubset) cil managed

Docs.param: The desired subset of the original bounds, which may be modified to a subset which is supported.
Docs.summary: Modifies the specified subset to one that can decoded from this codec.
Docs.returns: Returns true if this codec supports decoding the desired subset, otherwise false. The final subset can be used with .

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult IncrementalDecode ();
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult IncrementalDecode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Start or continue the incremental decode.
Docs.returns: Returns if all lines requested in have been completely decoded. otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Unlike , this does not do any filling. This is left up to the caller, since they may be skipping lines or continuing the decode later.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult IncrementalDecode (out int rowsDecoded);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult IncrementalDecode(int32 rowsDecoded) cil managed

Docs.param: The total number of lines initialized. Only meaningful if this method returns .
Docs.summary: Start or continue the incremental decode.
Docs.returns: Returns if all lines requested in have been completely decoded. otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Unlike , this does not do any filling. This is left up to the caller, since they may be skipping lines or continuing the decode later.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult StartIncrementalDecode (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, IntPtr pixels, int rowBytes);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult StartIncrementalDecode(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, native int pixels, int32 rowBytes) cil managed

Docs.param: The image information of the destination. If the dimensions do not match those of , this implies a scale.
The memory to write to. Needs to be large enough to hold the subset, if present, or the full image.
The stride of the memory to write to.
Docs.summary: Prepare for an incremental decode with the specified options.
Docs.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult StartIncrementalDecode (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, IntPtr pixels, int rowBytes, SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions options);

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult StartIncrementalDecode(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, native int pixels, int32 rowBytes, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions options) cil managed

Docs.param: The image information of the destination. If the dimensions do not match those of , this implies a scale.
The memory to write to. Needs to be large enough to hold the subset, if present, or the full image.
The stride of the memory to write to.
The decoding options, including if memory is zero initialized and whether to decode a subset.
Docs.summary: Prepare for an incremental decode with the specified options.
Docs.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

The memory to write to. Needs to be large enough to hold the subset, if present, or the full image.
The stride of the memory to write to.
The decoding options, including if memory is zero initialized and whether to decode a subset.
The color table to use.
The size of the color table.
Docs.summary: Prepare for an incremental decode with the specified options.
Docs.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.
